choices.B: The supplicant used the PAP authentication method.
choices.A: The failure reason was user entered the wrong username.
choices.F: The user is being authenticated using 802.1X.
choices.D: The user was authenticated against the Active Directory then also against the ISE interal user database and both fails.
choices.E: The NAS switch port where the user connected to has a MAC address of 44:03:A7:62:41:7F
choices.H: The supplicant stopped responding to ISE which caused the failure.

discussion.content: F looks ok as they are asking which method is being used.

Should be A instead of F?

F is incorrect since user was not authenticated...

Client Provisioning Policy
Define the Client Provisioning Policy to determine what users will receive upon login and user session initiation:
For Agent Configuration: version of agent, agent profile, agent compliance module, and/or agent customization package.
For Native Supplicant Configuration: wizard profile and/or wizard. Drag and drop rules to change the order.

questions.question_text: Which components must be selected for a client provisioning policy to do a Posture check on the Cisco ISE?
Which option describes the purpose of configuring Native Supplicant Profile on the Cisco ISE?

choices.D: It enforces the use of MSCHAPv2 or EAP-TLS for 802.1X authentication.
choices.C: It helps employees add and manage new devices by entering the MAC address for the device.
choices.B: It provides posture assessments and remediation for devices that are attempting to gain access to the corporate network.
choices.A: It is used to register personal devices on the network.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. If a user with privilege 15 is matching this command set on Cisco ISE 2.0, which two commands can the user execute? (Choose three.)

comments.content: It's tricky. "conf" would be permitted, but not "configure", since the rule permits conf not conf*

discussion.content: "configure terminal" should work or not ? and why ?

questions.question_text: A user reports that a switchs RADIUS accounting packets are not being seen on the Cisco ISE server. Which command is the user missing in the switchs configuration?

choices.B: aaa accounting network default start-stop group radius
choices.A: aaa accounting exec default start-stop group radius
choices.D: aaa accounting resource default start-stop group radius
